alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 10:32AM MDT until August 11 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Ashton. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridge 3 miles north and 1 1/2 mile east of Ashton * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CDT Friday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 12.8 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 530 PM CDT.
